intro: Anagallis arvensis proles micrantha, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear or dwarf mouse-ear, is a low-growing flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It is an annual or biennial species, often blooming from late spring to early summer. Its compact growth habit and delicate appearance make it a notable yet often overlooked component of wildflower ecosystems.
